member.name: T:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights
member.summary: Specifies access rights to a memory-mapped file that is not associated with a file on disk.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.CopyOnWrite
member.summary: The right to read and write to a file with the restriction that write operations will not be seen by other processes.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.Write
member.summary: The right to add data to a file or remove data from a file.

member.summary: The right to open and copy a file as read-only.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.Execute
member.summary: The right to run an application file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.Delete
member.summary: The right to delete a file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ReadPermissions
member.summary: The right to open and copy access and audit rules from a file. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, or extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ChangePermissions
member.summary: The right to change the security and audit rules associated with a file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.TakeOwnership
member.summary: The right to change the owner of a file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ReadWrite
member.summary: The right to open and copy a file, and the right to add data to a file or remove data from a file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ReadExecute
member.summary: The right to open and copy a folder or file as read-only, and to run application files. This right includes the right and the right.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ReadWriteExecute
member.summary: The right to open and copy a file, the right to add data to a file or remove data from a file, and the right to run an application file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.FullControl
member.summary: The right to exert full control over a file, and to modify access control and audit rules. This value represents the right to do anything with a file and is the combination of all rights in this enumeration.

member.name: T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights
member.summary: Defines the access rights to use when you create access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadData
member.summary: Specifies the right to read data from the pipe. This does not include the right to read file system attributes, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.WriteData
member.summary: Specifies the right to write data to a pipe. This does not include the right to write file system attributes or extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to read file system attributes from a pipe. This does not include the right to read data, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.WriteAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to write file system attributes to a pipe. This does not include the right to write data or extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadExtendedAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to read extended file system attributes from a pipe. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.WriteExtendedAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to write extended file system attributes to a pipe. This does not include the right to write file attributes or data.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.CreateNewInstance
member.summary: Specifies the right to create a new pipe. Setting this right also sets the right.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.Delete
member.summary: Specifies the right to delete a pipe.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadPermissions
member.summary: Specifies the right to read access and audit rules from the pipe. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, or extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ChangePermissions
member.summary: Specifies the right to change the security and audit rules that are associated with a pipe.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.TakeOwnership
member.summary: Specifies the right to change the owner of a pipe. Note that owners of a pipe have full access to that resource.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.Synchronize
member.summary: Specifies whether the application can wait for a pipe handle to synchronize with the completion of an I/O operation.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.FullControl
member.summary: Specifies the right to exert full control over a pipe, and to modify access control and audit rules. This value represents the combination of all rights in this enumeration.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.Read
member.summary: Specifies the right to read from the pipe. This right includes the , , , and rights.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.Write
member.summary: Specifies the right to write to the pipe. This right includes the , , and rights.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadWrite
member.summary: Specifies the right to read and write from the pipe. This right includes the , , , , , , and rights.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.AccessSystemSecurity
member.summary: Specifies the right to make changes to the system access control list (SACL).

member.name: T:System.Linq.ParallelExecutionMode
member.summary: The query execution mode is a hint that specifies how the system should handle performance trade-offs when parallelizing queries.

member.name: F:System.Linq.ParallelExecutionMode.Default
member.summary: This is the default setting. PLINQ will examine the query's structure and will only parallelize the query if will likely result in speedup. If the query structure indicates that speedup is not likely to be obtained, then PLINQ will execute the query as an ordinary LINQ to Objects query.

member.name: F:System.Linq.ParallelExecutionMode.ForceParallelism
member.summary: Parallelize the entire query, even if that means using high-overhead algorithms. Use this flag in cases where you know that parallel execution of the query will result in speedup, but PLINQ in the Default mode would execute it as sequential.

member.name: T:System.Linq.ParallelMergeOptions
member.summary: Specifies the preferred type of output merge to use in a query. In other words, it indicates how PLINQ should merge the results from the various partitions back into a single result sequence. This is a hint only, and may not be respected by the system when parallelizing all queries.

member.name: F:System.Linq.ParallelMergeOptions.Default
member.summary: Use the default merge type, which is AutoBuffered.

member.name: F:System.Linq.ParallelMergeOptions.NotBuffered
member.summary: Use a merge without output buffers. As soon as result elements have been computed, make that element available to the consumer of the query.

member.name: F:System.Linq.ParallelMergeOptions.AutoBuffered
member.summary: Use a merge with output buffers of a size chosen by the system. Results will accumulate into an output buffer before they are available to the consumer of the query.

member.name: F:System.Linq.ParallelMergeOptions.FullyBuffered
member.summary: Use a merge with full output buffers. The system will accumulate all of the results before making any of them available to the consumer of the query.

member.name: T:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType
member.summary: Describes the node types for the nodes of an expression tree.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Add
member.summary: An addition operation, such as a + b, without overflow checking, for numeric operands.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.AddChecked
member.summary: An addition operation, such as (a + b), with overflow checking, for numeric operands.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.And
member.summary: A bitwise or logical AND operation, such as (a & b) in C# and (a And b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.AndAlso
member.summary: A conditional AND operation that evaluates the second operand only if the first operand evaluates to true. It corresponds to (a && b) in C# and (a AndAlso b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.ArrayLength
member.summary: An operation that obtains the length of a one-dimensional array, such as array.Length.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.ArrayIndex
member.summary: An indexing operation in a one-dimensional array, such as array[index] in C# or array(index) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Call
member.summary: A method call, such as in the obj.sampleMethod() expression.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Coalesce
member.summary: A node that represents a null coalescing operation, such as (a ?? b) in C# or If(a, b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Conditional
member.summary: A conditional operation, such as a > b ? a : b in C# or If(a > b, a, b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Constant
member.summary: A constant value.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Convert
member.summary: A cast or conversion operation, such as (SampleType)obj in C#or CType(obj, SampleType) in Visual Basic. For a numeric conversion, if the converted value is too large for the destination type, no exception is thrown.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.ConvertChecked
member.summary: A cast or conversion operation, such as (SampleType)obj in C#or CType(obj, SampleType) in Visual Basic. For a numeric conversion, if the converted value does not fit the destination type, an exception is thrown.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Divide
member.summary: A division operation, such as (a / b), for numeric operands.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Equal
member.summary: A node that represents an equality comparison, such as (a == b) in C# or (a = b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.ExclusiveOr
member.summary: A bitwise or logical XOR operation, such as (a ^ b) in C# or (a Xor b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.GreaterThan
member.summary: A "greater than" comparison, such as (a > b).

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.GreaterThanOrEqual
member.summary: A "greater than or equal to" comparison, such as (a >= b).

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Invoke
member.summary: An operation that invokes a delegate or lambda expression, such as sampleDelegate.Invoke().

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Lambda
member.summary: A lambda expression, such as a => a + a in C# or Function(a) a + a in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.LeftShift
member.summary: A bitwise left-shift operation, such as (a << b).

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.LessThan
member.summary: A "less than" comparison, such as (a < b).

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.LessThanOrEqual
member.summary: A "less than or equal to" comparison, such as (a <= b).

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.ListInit
member.summary: An operation that creates a new object and initializes it from a list of elements, such as new List<SampleType>(){ a, b, c } in C# or Dim sampleList = { a, b, c } in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.MemberAccess
member.summary: An operation that reads from a field or property, such as obj.SampleProperty.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.MemberInit
member.summary: An operation that creates a new object and initializes one or more of its members, such as new Point { X = 1, Y = 2 } in C# or New Point With {.X = 1, .Y = 2} in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Modulo
member.summary: An arithmetic remainder operation, such as (a % b) in C# or (a Mod b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Multiply
member.summary: A multiplication operation, such as (a * b), without overflow checking, for numeric operands.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.MultiplyChecked
member.summary: An multiplication operation, such as (a * b), that has overflow checking, for numeric operands.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Negate
member.summary: An arithmetic negation operation, such as (-a). The object a should not be modified in place.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.UnaryPlus
member.summary: A unary plus operation, such as (+a). The result of a predefined unary plus operation is the value of the operand, but user-defined implementations might have unusual results.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.NegateChecked
member.summary: An arithmetic negation operation, such as (-a), that has overflow checking. The object a should not be modified in place.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.New
member.summary: An operation that calls a constructor to create a new object, such as new SampleType().

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.NewArrayInit
member.summary: An operation that creates a new one-dimensional array and initializes it from a list of elements, such as new SampleType[]{a, b, c} in C# or New SampleType(){a, b, c} in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.NewArrayBounds
member.summary: An operation that creates a new array, in which the bounds for each dimension are specified, such as new SampleType[dim1, dim2] in C# or New SampleType(dim1, dim2) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Not
member.summary: A bitwise complement or logical negation operation. In C#, it is equivalent to (~a) for integral types and to (!a) for Boolean values. In Visual Basic, it is equivalent to (Not a). The object a should not be modified in place.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.NotEqual
member.summary: An inequality comparison, such as (a != b) in C# or (a <> b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Or
member.summary: A bitwise or logical OR operation, such as (a | b) in C# or (a Or b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.OrElse
member.summary: A short-circuiting conditional OR operation, such as (a || b) in C# or (a OrElse b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Parameter
member.summary: A reference to a parameter or variable that is defined in the context of the expression. For more information, see .

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Power
member.summary: A mathematical operation that raises a number to a power, such as (a ^ b) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Quote
member.summary: An expression that has a constant value of type . A node can contain references to parameters that are defined in the context of the expression it represents.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.RightShift
member.summary: A bitwise right-shift operation, such as (a >> b).

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Subtract
member.summary: A subtraction operation, such as (a - b), without overflow checking, for numeric operands.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.SubtractChecked
member.summary: An arithmetic subtraction operation, such as (a - b), that has overflow checking, for numeric operands.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.TypeAs
member.summary: An explicit reference or boxing conversion in which null is supplied if the conversion fails, such as (obj as SampleType) in C# or TryCast(obj, SampleType) in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.TypeIs
member.summary: A type test, such as obj is SampleType in C# or TypeOf obj is SampleType in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Assign
member.summary: An assignment operation, such as (a = b).

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Block
member.summary: A block of expressions.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.DebugInfo

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Decrement
member.summary: A unary decrement operation, such as (a - 1) in C# and Visual Basic. The object a should not be modified in place.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Dynamic
member.summary: A dynamic operation.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Default
member.summary: A default value.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Extension
member.summary: An extension expression.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Goto
member.summary: A "go to" expression, such as goto Label in C# or GoTo Label in Visual Basic.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Increment
member.summary: A unary increment operation, such as (a + 1) in C# and Visual Basic. The object a should not be modified in place.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Index
member.summary: An index operation or an operation that accesses a property that takes arguments.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Label
member.summary: A label.

member.name: F:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Switch
member.summary: A switch operation, such as switch in C# or Select Case in Visual Basic.

member.summary: The certificate verification result is valid.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.SignatureVerificationResult.AssemblyIdentityMismatch
member.summary: The identity of the assembly specified in the /asm:assembly/asm:assemblyIdentity node of the manifest does not match the identity of the assembly in the Authenticode signature in the /asm:assembly/ds:signature/ds:KeyInfo/msrel:RelData/r:license/r:grant/as:ManifestInformation/as:assemblyIdentity node.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.SignatureVerificationResult.ContainingSignatureInvalid
member.summary: The strong name signature does not verify in the object. Because the strong name signature wraps the Authenticode signature, someone could replace the Authenticode signature with a signature of their choosing. To prevent this, this error code is returned if the strong name does not verify because substituting a part of the strong name signature will invalidate it.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.SignatureVerificationResult.PublicKeyTokenMismatch
member.summary: The public key token from the manifest identity in the /asm:assembly/asm:AssemblyIdentity node does not match the public key token of the key that is used to sign the manifest.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.SignatureVerificationResult.PublisherMismatch
member.summary: The publisher name from /asm:assembly/asmv2:publisherIdentity does not match the subject name of the signing certificate, or the issuer key hash from the same publisherIdentity node does not match the key hash of the signing certificate.

member.name: T:System.Threading.LockRecursionPolicy
member.summary: Specifies whether a lock can be entered multiple times by the same thread.

member.name: F:System.Threading.LockRecursionPolicy.NoRecursion
member.summary: If a thread tries to enter a lock recursively, an exception is thrown. Some classes may allow certain recursions when this setting is in effect.

member.name: F:System.Threading.LockRecursionPolicy.SupportsRecursion
member.summary: A thread can enter a lock recursively. Some classes may restrict this capability.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default property values.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the lock recursion policy.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the lock recursion policy.

member.name: P:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.CurrentReadCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of unique threads that have entered the lock in read mode.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.EnterReadLock
member.summary: Tries to enter the lock in read mode.
member.exception: The property is and the current thread has already entered read mode. -or-The recursion number would exceed the capacity of the counter. This limit is so large that applications should never encounter it.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.EnterUpgradeableReadLock
member.summary: Tries to enter the lock in upgradeable mode.
member.exception: The property is and the current thread has already entered the lock in any mode. -or-The current thread has entered read mode, so trying to enter upgradeable mode would create the possibility of a deadlock. -or-The recursion number would exceed the capacity of the counter. The limit is so large that applications should never encounter it.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.EnterWriteLock
member.summary: Tries to enter the lock in write mode.
member.exception: The property is and the current thread has already entered the lock in any mode. -or-The current thread has entered read mode, so trying to enter the lock in write mode would create the possibility of a deadlock. -or-The recursion number would exceed the capacity of the counter. The limit is so large that applications should never encounter it.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.ExitReadLock
member.summary: Reduces the recursion count for read mode, and exits read mode if the resulting count is 0 (zero).
member.exception: The current thread has not entered the lock in read mode.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.ExitUpgradeableReadLock
member.summary: Reduces the recursion count for upgradeable mode, and exits upgradeable mode if the resulting count is 0 (zero).
member.exception: The current thread has not entered the lock in upgradeable mode.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.ExitWriteLock
member.summary: Reduces the recursion count for write mode, and exits write mode if the resulting count is 0 (zero).
member.exception: The current thread has not entered the lock in write mode.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current thread has entered the lock in read mode.
member.returns: true if the current thread has entered read mode; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.IsUpgradeableReadLockHeld
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current thread has entered the lock in upgradeable mode.
member.returns: true if the current thread has entered upgradeable mode; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.IsWriteLockHeld
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current thread has entered the lock in write mode.
member.returns: true if the current thread has entered write mode; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.RecursionPolicy
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the recursion policy for the current object.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that specifies the lock recursion policy.

member.name: P:System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim.RecursiveReadCount
member.summary: Gets the number of times the current thread has entered the lock in read mode, as an indication of recursion.
member.returns: 0 (zero) if the current thread has not entered read mode, 1 if the thread has entered read mode but has not entered it recursively, or n if the thread has entered the lock recursively n - 1 times.

member.summary: Gets the number of times the current thread has entered the lock in upgradeable mode, as an indication of recursion.

member.summary: Gets the number of times the current thread has entered the lock in write mode, as an indication of recursion.
member.returns: 0 if the current thread has not entered write mode, 1 if the thread has entered write mode but has not entered it recursively, or n if the thread has entered write mode recursively n - 1 times.
